lexUnit.name: confide.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tell someone about a secret or private matter in confidence

sentence.text: She confides , ` He gets a few drinks and wants to wipe everybody out . "
` He 'll be all right , " Aranyos confided .
` She 's a good girl , " he confided , offering the plate to Lucinda .
` I still do not trust the parasite , sir , " Jinkwa confided .
` For a long time I thought I did , " she confided softly .
Bloody dangerous piece of road , between you and me , " he confided .
` Originally I was going to race bikes , " confides Blues .
` You see , I work in a cafeteria , " confided the girl , as they moved off .
` Nerina 's always on at me to wear western clothes , " confided Mrs Khalid , ` but I like to be comfortable .
He confided that Hawaii was the most difficult place in the world for him .
After about the fourth or fifth month into the course of treatments , I began to feel a lessening of the pain , but not once had she confided that anything was wrong .
On a more light-hearted note , a friend of mine had become sexually involved with a woman he met at a party , although he confided that he had niggling doubts about the relationship .
The students confide that what they really like is the outing , which gives them an excuse to escape from Dublin and meet the ` quality " .
In later years , Roderick confided that he had been far from happy with the title , for the book certainly was not " elementary " .
He has confided that he once told Claudia that in real life people do not go around analysing everyday rituals .
A white-haired waiter with a drooping moustache confided that the marinade was a speciality of the chef .
Just in time she stopped herself from confiding that she 'd almost forgotten how to dance .
At half past one Geoffrey confided he was worried about Dawn Allenby .
She had confided she was in love with someone else , but he did n't believe her .
` Your uncle , for his own reasons , confided something to Francis and Francis is dead .
When confiding the news to Greeves , he said , ` My long night talk with Dyson and Tolkien had a good deal to do with it . "
When she first confided the name of her secret love to a friend she said : ` You 'll never believe it , but it 's David Mellor .
It is not good for a physician to confide personal details of his life to a patient .
Unfortunately he could not confide this knowledge to his upper-management team and so he had to allow his upper-management team to think he was losing his grip .
The two girls stayed up for hours , and by the end of the evening a date had been arranged for the Paris adventure , and Clarissa had confided her plan for the Saturday afternoon of the visit .
In turn , Maureen confided her hopeless love for Chris .
During the weeks directly afterwards he confided his distress in Keith Gregory and it established a strong bond between them .
After a while , Cissie learned not to speak of Maisie , but she confided her sadness in Beth .
Theo had been confiding his disappointment with the way his life was turning out , and Vincent quickly swept in with an indictment : ` It seems to me that the whole art business is rotten . "
Later , when he and even his customary buttonhole of Michaelmas daisies were drooping , he confided his deep despair .
Never before had a Brother confided such a personal detail .
` Do n't worry about it , " he told her calmly , when she confided her frustration .
` And now I 've confided my murky past , that must make us more than acquaintances . "
To me , dear child , you confided your secret .
This much had been confided to him ; and he had deemed it discreet to pry no further -- had been persuaded of the wisdom of discretion .
She had confided this to Liz in a tearful moment , not long after Jonathan had run off with the Williams girl .
She was close to him , confiding secrets which were only for him to hear .
John Harbour , confiding something important to Babs Osborne , kept glancing at Meredith .
He had never confided any of his suspicions about being followed to Mr Malik .
She had always confided in Tony , but for some reason she could not confide that .
` How ? " she asked , disappointed that he was n't confiding in her .
Jack had wondered what she herself felt , but Tina had not confided in him .
Dad was very upset that she had n't confided in us .
` I confided to Alain my ambition to establish a school such as this .
He had confided to her that he himself suffered with back trouble .
But she confided to Jean-Claude that this was a concession wrung from her to avoid argument : not something she had initiated , or enjoyed .
A week later a still very much astonished Rosemary had confided to Leith that she was indeed in love with Travis .
` I ca n't take much more of this , " he confided to Lily , and she told him to shush .
She had confided to Ruth that she was pregnant again .
` It is not exactly true , " Marguerite confided as Alain went out to answer the telephone .
` I had to get away , " he confided through gravel .
` I do n't know what to do , " Muriel confided on the telephone to Jane Dent .
Whatever secret he had been hoping to confide on that short walk to the House would remain for ever unspoken .
` Sweet and very beautiful lady , forgive me what I am going to confide .
But it is n't something they 'll expect her to confide even if they know about it .
